title: I am going through divorce. My ex emptied out the bank accounts and apartment and took our son in a 24 hour period
question: a year ago. I immediately filed for divorce. She left with rent due the following week and no notice. We were on a month to month lease. At time of trial, would it be likely and could I request any return of funds since no notice was provided?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Child support,Divorce and bankruptcy,Child custody,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Child support and custody
answers: If the funds that were taken were her separate property, you would have no right to any reimbursement. If the funds were community property, you would be entitled to reimbursement for half.

Until the "community" is broken by a separation, community assets belong to the community, and so do community debts, no matter who earned them or incurred them, respectively, and no, no notice is required from one spouse to the other to use community money.

If you're worried about getting a fair shake on the division of assets, spousal and child support, child custody and visitation, etc., hire a family lawyer.
